page.title: 08THE VILLAGE JEWELLER
page.content: My father Mr.A.C.Reid has been a jeweller in Dairsie for twenty years. He makes his own jewellery and some- times my mum helps with the designs. A while ago he made a small silver plane and I am trying to make an aeroplane the same. The aeroplane I am making is going to be made of brass and when it has been polished by a buff it will be lacquered. The work- shop is full of expensive tools and equipment. The rolling mill is very expensive it flattens pieces of metal. Other tools are the piercing saw, hand graver,chasing tools,scribe,drill, shears,needle files,torch,vice,riffler file,centre punch. Every time the Open Golf tournament comes to St.Andrews my Dad makes jewellery to go on show. Last time he made a rose which had a lot of detail. Matthew Reid
